name: Niya-Atha Raja
description: The Niya-Atha Raja is characterized by its impressive stature, with a commanding presence and keen eyes, often wielding a Tulwar and possessing an aura of magical resistance.
memorable: Its ability to frighten enemies with a loud bellow while providing charm immunity to allies creates a unique battlefield dynamic.
goals: To control the battlefield and protect its allies while using intimidation tactics against foes.
relations: Typically found among fey creatures, often allied with other magical beings or guardians of nature.
environment: Commonly encountered in enchanted forests and other mystical locales.
strengths: Resistance to being charmed or frightened, and advantage on saves against spells bolsters its durability against magic.
weaknesses: Loses certain abilities like Evasion and Magic Resistance while enlarged, which requires tactical consideration.
attacks: Can strike with a melee Tulwar or a ranged Dart, and uses a War Bellow to cause fear in nearby enemies.
most_powerful_ability: War Bellow, a powerful ability that can frighten all nearby hostile creatures.
equipment: Wields a Tulwar, a curved sword favored by fey warriors.
senses: Has a passive perception of 14, indicating average awareness of surrounding threats.
skills: Proficient in perception, though its capability is average.
additional_information: Can enlarge itself to increase its physical size and damage output.
Immunity to being charmed and frightened enhances its role as a guardian.
The 'Commanding Bulk' ability boosts ally morale and effectiveness in combat.
It can tactically reduce its size to regain abilities.
The Niya-Atha Raja's Dexterity and Charisma make it a formidable opponent.
test_queries: fey creature that can enlarge itself
monster that frightens enemies with a bellow
formidable fey protector with charm immunity
swift attacker with melee and ranged options
